intro: Rodriguezia brachystachys, commonly known as the dwarf flame tree, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, elliptical leaflets. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a fibrous coat. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in warm climates for its vibrant floral display.
